intro: Ligusticum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy ligusticum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Ligusticum hirsutum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or alpine gardens.
